intro: Lapsana crispa, commonly known as the common cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, waste areas, and along roadsides. Lapsana crispa is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat various ailments.
